net.cloud.client.file.request

Class CachedFileRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.file.request.FileRequest<T>
      • net.cloud.client.file.request.LoadRequest<CachedFile>
        • net.cloud.client.file.request.CachedFileRequest

  • public class CachedFileRequest
extends LoadRequest<CachedFile>
    A request which asks for a CachedFile to be retrieved. The file is loaded from a cache file using the corresponding cache table, so that the file contains the bytes from the file. A CachedFile is effectively read-only and so this is a LoadRequest.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int indexInCache
      The index into the cache for the file we want
      private FileAddress tableAddress
      A separate file address for the cache table

    • Constructor Detail

      • CachedFileRequest

        public CachedFileRequest(int indexInCache,
                         FileAddress cacheAddress)
        Create a request for a single cached file. This constructor only requires the address of the cache file, and will create the address to the table on its own based on the cache address. The table's address will be set to the same location, with "Table" added into the filename.
        Ex: ./cache.dat => ./cacheTable.dat
        The provided index must be within bounds, or the request will encounter an exception.
        Parameters:
        indexInCache - The index of the file within the cache
        cacheAddress - The location of the cache file itself

      • CachedFileRequest

        public CachedFileRequest(int indexInCache,
                         FileAddress tableAddress,
                         FileAddress cacheAddress)
        Create a request for a single cached file. This will use both addresses, one separately for each file. The super class will be used to hold the cache address, whilst this holds the table address. The provided index must be within bounds, or the request will encounter an exception.
        Parameters:
        indexInCache - The index of the file within the cache
        tableAddress - The location of the cache table file
        cacheAddress - The location of the cache file itself

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(RequestHandler handler)
        Description copied from class: FileRequest
        Have the request ship itself off for handling. This takes advantage of dynamic binding. More specifically, double dispatch. Simply override it and call handler.handleRequest(this)
        Specified by:
        handle in class FileRequest<CachedFile>
        Parameters:
        handler - An instance of RequestHandler to take care of this request

      • getIndexInCache

        public int getIndexInCache()
        Returns:
        The index of the file within the cache

      • getTableAddress

        public FileAddress getTableAddress()
        Obtain the address for the cache table with information of the file this request is for. To obtain the address of the cache file itself, use FileRequest.address()
        Returns:
        The address to the cache table file
